intro: Noccaea klimesii, commonly known as the Klimes' rock白菜, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and mustard. The plant is characterized by its small, white flowers and basal rosette of leaves, adapted to survive in harsh, cold environments. It thrives in rocky and arid soils, often found in mountainous areas with limited moisture. Due to its unique ecological niche, Noccaea klimesii is of interest to botanists studying alpine flora and plant adaptation strategies.
